thread.title: Komets open with come from behind road win
thread.title_full: Komets open with come from behind road win

title: Komets open with come from behind road win
text:
Komets open with come from behind road win 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive October 17, 2015 Updated Oct 17, 2015 at 12:16 AM EDT 
KALAMAZOO, Mich. (21 Alive) - Shawn Szydlowski broke a 3-3 tie with his goal midway through the third period and helped the Komets to a 5-3 in Kalamazoo Friday night in the ECHL season opener for both teams. 
Alex Belzile, Mike Embach, Trevor Cheek, and Garrett Thompson also scored for the K's, with Thompson, who also had two assists, hitting an empty net to clich the win in the final seconds. 
Pat Nagle turned aside 34 of 37 shots for the win in goal. 
The two teams square off again in the Komets' home opener Saturday night. 
For highlights and postgame comments click on the video icon on the screen above.
